column4: displayName
Engineering Metadata
description
Approach to data generation
Specification of captured (measured / simulated / surveyed / dependent) variables.
Name of this variable.
The symbol used to describe this variable.
The unit or scale of this variable.
A value for the uncertainty of this variable.
The type the error is measured (e.g. standard deviation, percentage, â€¦)
The minimum value of this variable (use for ranges)
The maximum value of this variable (use for ranges)
Specification of controlled (observed / independent) variables.
Name of this variable.
The symbol used to describe this variable.
The unit or scale of this variable.
The (single) value of this variable.
The minimum value of this variable (use for ranges)
The maximum value of this variable  (use for ranges)
Phases of the observed system.
Name of a phase.
List of all component names for this phase (detailed information about components should be given under System Components).
Specification of a component of the object of research / observed system
Unique number that can be referred to in the metadata. Use if Name is not unique.
Name of this component.
The IUPAC International Chemical Identifier
Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry Specification
Chemical nomenclature created and developed by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC)
The amount of this component.
The unit in which the amount is measured.
Name of the force field belonging to this component (detailed information about the force field should be given under Force Field Parameters).
Specification of a force field
Name of the force field.
List of all parameter names relevant for this force field (detailed information about parameters should be given under Force Field Parameters entry).
Specification of a force field parameter.
Name of the parameter.
The symbol used to describe this parameter.
The unit or scale of this parameter.
The value of this parameter.
Parameters of the observed system.
Name of the parameter.
The symbol used to describe this parameter.
The unit or scale of this parameter.
The value of this parameter.
Specification of the spatial grid of the observation.
The number of 2D spatial cells.
The number of 3D spatial blocks.
The number of points in x-direction.
The number of points in y-direction.
The number of points in z-direction.
The distance between the points in x-direction.
The distance between the points in y-direction.
The distance between the points in z-direction.
The unit of the grid.
If the grid is not equidistant, the distance between points can be specified via a formular.

Temporal resolution of the observation. Can be defined either through a number of time steps with a definition of the intervals (with unit) between the timesteps (equidistant time steps) or a series of time steps together with the unit.
List of time points that describe the temporal resolution (if it can not be specified otherwise).
The number of time points (with equidistant distance).
Distance between two time points.
The unit of the temporal resolution.
Information about in- and outflows relevant for boundary conditions.
Name of the flow.
List of system component names this flow belongs to.
Shape of the flow.
Size of the flow.
The position of the flow.
Definition of boundaries of the observed system.
List of in- and outflows describing this boundary condition (detailed information about flows should be given under Flows).
List of all parameter names relevant for this boundary condition (detailed information about parameters should be given under Boundary Parameters.
Parameters relevant for boundary conditions.
Name of the parameter.
The symbol used to describe this parameter.
The unit or scale of this parameter.
The value of this parameter.
